cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles ENE of Cape Canaveral Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northeast then northeast, paralleling the southeast U.S. coast toward the Outer Banks of North Carolina before turning out over the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Near or just east of the Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Florida northward along the Georgia and Carolina coasts to the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible mainly offshore; sustained winds expected to remain below gale force at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous surf and rip currents; only minor coastal inundation expected, if any.
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional rainfall generally less than 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and elevated wave heights that could disrupt port operations and vessel scheduling.
